sections.heading: Overview
sections.content: Performing Arts at Raghubir Singh Junior Modern School serve as a medium for self-expression, creativity, and emotional development. The school integrates dance, music, and theatre into the curriculum to help children explore movement, rhythm, and performance with confidence and joy.

sections.heading: Dance
sections.content: Dance classes at RSJMS expose students to diverse classical and contemporary forms, including Indian folk, Kathak, and creative movement. Dance is not viewed merely as performance but as a discipline that fosters coordination, focus, teamwork, and cultural appreciation. The annual dance presentations showcase grace and storytelling through rhythm, often aligning with themes of empathy, unity, and celebration.

sections.heading: Music
sections.content: Music is an essential part of life at RSJMS. From morning assembly to classroom songs, children are surrounded by melody and rhythm. The music curriculum includes both Indian and Western traditions, where students learn vocals as well as instruments such as keyboards, tabla, and percussion. In addition to school choirs and orchestral groups, children perform at school events, nurturing both talent and confidence.

sections.heading: Theatre
sections.content: Theatre at RSJMS helps children build imagination, expression, and empathy. Role play, story dramatization, and short skits allow students to inhabit multiple perspectives and collaborate creatively. The schoolâ€™s annual productions and class performances are known for their professional quality and child-centric narratives that emphasize values, humour, and humanity.
